title: Peaceful Penetration
itunes:title: Peaceful Penetration
itunes:subtitle: The AIF in April to June 1918
description:
After playing a large role in halting the German Spring Offensive outside of Villers Bretonneux in April 1918, Australian troops saw an opportunity to hit back and recapture large sections of the German front line. But rather than launch a full scale battle, the unofficial operation 'Peaceful Penetration' managed to push the German line back an average of three miles with very little fighting.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
